channel.title: Pages on Maksym Prokopov personal blog

item.title: Travel
item.description: Очень люблю Юго-Восточную Азию за теплый климат и прекрасных людей. 2022 Italy, Rome 5 days 2022 Montenegro, Djenovichi 1 week 2021 Spain, Villa Joiosa 1 week perfect family beach rest, 1 week more than enough 2020 Spain, Barcelona cancelled due to Corona-19 :( 2019-2020 Norway, Asker 2 weeks 2019 Germany, Freiburg 3 days 2019 Austria, Vienna 1 month 2019 Турция, пригород Анталии 1 неделя 2 weeks 2019 Germany, Berlin 3 days 2019 Sicily, gastrotour 6 days 2018-2019 Thailand, Koh Samui 6 months 2018 Italy (Toskana region), gastrotour 6 days 2018 Finland (Jyväskylä, Helsinki) 3 days 2018 Germany, Hamburg 3 days 2017 Germany, Mannheim, Stuttgart, Heidelberg 1 month 2016 Egypt (Hurgada), Turkey (Istanbul) 2013-2014 Thailand (Bangkok, Ayutaya, Patthaya) [Cambodia (Siam-Riep, Sehanukville, Battamband, Campot, Phnom Penh)] 2012 Malaysia (Kuala Lumpur, isl.

item.title: Read
item.description: My interests currently lie in the following categories: Psyhology, self-improvement and mental health Domain Driven Design Lean production, lean services SRE and DevOps Here is my confession to the one of the greatest books about computer science: Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software if you are a computer science enthusiast, this is must read! Стейнбек говорил, что «плохой роман должен развлекать читателей, средний – воздействовать на их чувства, а лучший – озарять им путь»

item.title: Create
item.description: I beleive being creative is an essential part of being a human. Before I got my first computer Intel 386 DX 40 in 1994, I used to write small programs using MK61 programmable calculator, then a bit of soviet Corvette computer programming at school. Since that time I didn’t stop my journey with software engineering, but nowadays with more focus towards DevOps and SRE practices. My first book about software engineering was C++ by Bjarne Stroustrup.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, my name is Maksym Prokopov. These days I mostly involved in DevOps, Lean IT and IT services. A long time ago I started by web developer career from PHP 3.0.3 and have used lots of technlologies and programming languages. Surprisingly, but I started using PHP for my job today again after almost 18 years. What a destiny! Since 2006 I started using Ruby on Rails a lot. 2015 got addicted to Clojure and ClojureScript and did some production-ready things.
